title: RAM is used at 100% but sync goes very slowly (+1G space taken per hour)
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2.32.0-stable-021891a3`

OS & Version: `Canonical-Ubuntu-22.04-aarch64-2022.11.06-0`

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Mounted my 3TB hard drive and ran the command:
`erigon --torrent.download.rate=4000mb --datadir=/media/ethereum-archive-node`

#### Expected behaviour

Yesterday I started the command (28h before this post), and the downloading was going very fast without filling the RAM too much.
It filled 400GB of storage in around 4-5h without using too many resources.

#### Actual behaviour

Now, (after 28h of run), the RAM is filled at 100% (24GB of RAM) and the downloading is going extremely slow (around 1GB per hour).

Is this a normal behavior? Should I restart the downloader?

#### Additional informations

I am running erigon on an Oracle Cloud instance:
- 24GB of RAM
- 4 OCPU
- Network speed 4Gbps

I have added a block volume of 3TB to my instance which I formatted to be EXT4.

1. I see it using 6gb. See https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon#htop-shows-incorrect-memory-usage
2. I see you have no good peers GoodPeers                          eth66=2 eth67=0 - is eth67 enabled? Mainnet? 
3. seems you just have no peers
4. On mainnet old blocks (you are at 7M) are available in snapshots. You disabled them?

Hello,

Thank you for your answer

1. I think the memory usage is correct for three reasons:
- It is complicated for me to SSH to my server (it takes 1-2 min and sometimes it never connects)
- Oracle cloud memory usage have "holes" in it, like for some period of time he is not even able to retrieve the memory usage
- I tried to SIGINT the process, it didn't worked :'(
Maybe it is the processor usage that does all of this blocking and not the memory (but Oracle showed me 40-60% usage on processor maximum)
2. I don't know if peers are enabled, I just ran this command: `erigon --torrent.download.rate=4000mb --datadir=/media/ethereum-archive-node`
4. I don't know if I disabled anything, is there any other command that I have to do that is not just the above erigon command?

What I am looking for is to run an ethereum mainnet archive node on my oracle cloud computer, can you please give me the full command that would allow everything (ethereum mainnet, snapshop, fast download speed...) maybe my command was wrong.

Thanks in advance :)

1. My guess something else eating ram on server, maybe you didn’t disable SWAP. Erigon is ok for “kill -9”
2. Maybe you have some strict firewall. Is your node synced? If not - and you just started recently - i advise start from scratch and show new logs here, maybe there will be some error. Because it’s totally unclear for me why Erigon didn’t download snapshots by torrent. Your command must work. 
3. You can show “free -h”

My SIGINT have worked after some time, so I restarted by slightly changing the command:

`erigon --datadir /media/ethereum-archive-node/ --snapshots=true --torrent.download.rate=64mb --chain=mainnet`

(reduced the --torent.download.rate in case it was what is blocking)

Would the option: "--fakepow=true" be better to set for faster download or not?

2. My node is not yet synced
3. Sorry could not run free -h before my SIGINT stopped the program, will post it here if I have issues with the new start

Hello, it has been more than 24h, I have started the program using this command:
`erigon --datadir /media/ethereum-archive-node/ --snapshots=true --torrent.download.rate=64mb --chain=mainnet --fakepow=true`

And it seems like working, I am at 756G in disk size I think it is going at normal speed?

The issue seems that I wanted to use all of my internet power which putted the torrent download rate too fast and filled up the memory.

There might be an issue with erigon with high torrent download speed. (I tried with --torrent.download.rate=4000mb, and --torrent.download.rate=256mb and both filled the memory)

I think it would be great if someone else tried high speed torrent downloads
Internet is not main bottleneck - Execution stage will take days

Something fishy is going on with torrents, today I did a clean start and my download speed was capped at 20 kb/sec(stucked at this cap speed for 10 min)
All settings - default, network - BSC mainnet
I restarted(ctrl+c) and specified manually --torrent.download.rate=512mb and got just 10 mb/s capped.
Why cannot I download at several Gbit/sec?... Machine has 25 gbit/sec link(ec2)
The best I could get is 45 mb/sec after altering torrent related settings... still very slow considering modern networks capacity

1. Erigon can't detect how big is your network channel. default are set for laptop-like scenario and fare-use of resources (if some-body downloading from you data, it must not impact overall node performance). see --torrent.* settings. 
2. It depends on how many seeds you have and seed's setting --torrent.upload.rate 
3. BSC community - is mostly corporate-style and likely they have Firewall settings which just cut-off bittorrent seeding. So, it's question of community - ho likely they seed historical snapshots. 
4. Historical snapshots - using usual BitTorrent protocol and files, it means if somebody want to support network - he doesn't need Erigon. Can seed files from desktop or from public seedbox service. 
5. About `would have banned ...for touching piece 384 after failed piece check`: you see this because on our (maybe not only our) public seedboxes files were corrupted by anti-virus with message like: "antivirus decided that this files are related to Crypto-related project called 'Erigon' ". So your Erigon does catch that some peer send to you corrupted data and ban such peer. 
6. I very often download Mainnet snapshots with 200MiB/s, so - likely it's not erigon-related bottleneck.
Also make sure: open tcp + udp 42069 on your firewall

After several restarts I got decent downloading speed of about 100-150 mb/sec.
But there's definitely a bug in Erigon, because my initial first download was capped at 20kb/sec for like 20min. 
Same ports, settings and restart and I got speed measured in mb/sec
